title: Jeera/Cumin seeds Rice 🍚
content:
Main course: Jeera Rice  Servings: 4 Duration: 20 mins Rice varieties are essential, unique and quick lunch box recipe for any one at home, it's mild spicy but tastes amazing with other spices and vegetables. I have been shared many rice recipes they are tempting and traditional too 🙂 You can glance below links for rice varieties:
  • Coconut Rice 🍚 || Lunch || Diwali
  • Mint Pulao With Cucumber 🥒 Raita || Lunch / Dinner
  • Rajma Pulao 😋 || Red Kidney Beans Pulao || Special Rice || Festive Season
  • Vangi Bath / Brinjal 🍆 Fried Rice || Karnataka recipe || Navratri Spl
  • Mint Veggie Biryani / Pudina Vegetable Biryani
  • South Indian Thali || Andhra Bhojanam 😀|| Veg South Indian Lunch|| Weekend Special
  • Palak Mutter Pulao / Spinach Peas Pulao 👌
Today, I prepared a simple and authentic rice flavoured with Jeera, Peas and other spices. You can serve it with any kind of gravy curry for extra zest and richness in Jeera Rice 🍚   Let's start with ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Basmati Rice 🍚 - 160 gms - 1 cup
  • Water - 2 cups
  • Cumin seeds - 1 1/2 tb sp
  • Cumin powder - 1 tb sp
  • Green chillies - 4 - chopped
  • Butter - 2 tb sp
  • Salt - 1 tsp
  • Green peas - 80 gms
  • Onion - sliced - 1/2 cup
  • Bay leaf 🍃 - 1
  • Clove - 1
  • Cinnamon - 1/2 inch piece
Procedure:
  • Add rice in a bowl and wash twice with water
  • Strain water and add washed rice in rice cooker
  • Heat a skillet pan over medium heat
  • Add Butter, clove, cinnamon, bay leaf & cumin seeds
  • Let them splutter
  • Next add green chillies, onion & peas
  • Saute 1 min and add cumin powder & salt..mix well
  • Turn off heat and transfer this to rice cooker
  • Add water .. mix gently with spatula
  • I cooked rice in electric rice cooker ( you can also use pressure cooker and cook for 2 whistles )
  • Rice cooked well.. mix gently with spatula and serve
  • Serve it hot with Cauliflower/Gobi Butter Masala || Side Dish || Restaurant Style 🙂
  • Onion Salan 🍛|Side dish
  • Happy cooking & enjoy your day 🙂
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Adjust spices according to taste
  • Instead of Basmati Rice you can also use regular rice
  • Instead of butter you can also use Ghee
